trans-unit.source: Provides methods and properties for all glyph classes that an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> displays when it is selected on the workflow design surface.
Some glyphs that are displayed on an activity designer can be selected by the user while others cannot.
When a user selects a glyph that can be selected, the glyph changes appearance on the activity design surface.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph> class is the base class for all glyph classes that change appearance when a user selects it on the activity design surface.
When implemented in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph"></xref> class.
Returns the bounds for the selection glyph on the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.

Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph.GetBounds%2A> returns a rectangle one-and-one-half times the size of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Bounds%2A> of `designer`.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with which the selection glyph is associated.
`true` to indicate whether the selection glyph appears on the activity designer surface; otherwise, `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds for the glyph.
Returns an array of rectangles that represents the selected glyph's grab handles.
Grab handles are the small boxes on the edge of a selected glyph that a user can grab and move to drag or resize the glyph.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with which the selection glyph is associated.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> array of the grab handles to display on the selected glyph.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the selection glyph is the primary of all selected glyphs on the design surface.
`true` if the selection glyph is the primary selected glyph on the activity designer; otherwise, `false`.
Performs any tasks required to render the glyph on the activity designer surface.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionGlyph.OnPaint%2A> draws all elements of the glyph that the user selects, including the glyphs grab handles.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> to perform fill and drawing tasks.
`true` to indicate that the glyph appears on the design surface; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme"></xref> to use to access ambient property settings.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> from which to obtain information about user actions.
Gets the view priority of the glyph on the activity designer.
The possible priority settings are defined by the following <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph> fields:

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.HighestPriority>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.LowestPriority>, and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerGlyph.NormalPriority>.
An integer that represents the view priority of the glyph on the activity designer.
